body:
Marko,
Is there any place in your code where you do a forced GC, ie call
runtime.GC()? That could explain the long GC. Perhaps you reboot daily and
as part of the initialization do a runtime.GC()?
- Rick

On Fri, Jul 17, 2015 at 9:58 AM, Rick Hudson <rlh@golang.org> wrote:

> Thanks, I've been looking at this and for some reason we incorrectly
> attempt to do a STW when one of the gc mark helpers is active and we have
> no way to stop an active gc mark helper. It is clearly a bug that we need
> to understand better. Once a day in production seems like a lot.
>
